historyAndTruth.title: Who We Are
historyAndTruth.p1: History doesn't show us the complete truth. It gives us only a partial view of events. What really happened and what was false is impossible to know with absolute certainty.
historyAndTruth.p2: But one thing is clear - whatever happened, happened in reality. Those events were real. People experienced them. Decisions were made. Consequences were faced.
historyAndTruth.p3: Our work is to see those events through our lens. We don't claim any ultimate truth. We simply share our perspective.

whyIWrite.title: Why We Write
whyIWrite.intro:
Every person sees the world differently. Our background, experience, and values shape our understanding.

We write on this blog because:
whyIWrite.reason1: First, we believe it's important to hear different perspectives. When we look at the same event from multiple angles, we develop a deeper understanding.
whyIWrite.reason2: Second, writing is a thinking process for us. When we write, we force ourselves to be clear. We give structure to our thoughts.
whyIWrite.reason3: Third, we want dialogue. We see this blog as a conversation. You read, you think, and perhaps you disagree. That's a good thing.

myApproach.title: Our Approach
myApproach.intro: We write in three main areas:
myApproach.history: History - Attempting to understand past events in present context. History is not a collection of dead facts. It's a study of patterns, motivations, and human nature.
myApproach.technology: Technology - How technology is shaping our lives, society, and future. Both its possibilities and its dangers.
myApproach.politics: Politics - Analysis of current events. Power, decisions, and their impact. We don't promote any ideology, we simply observe and analyze.
